title: Women's Rugby League World Cup 2021 to feature increased turnaround time between matches
text:
The women's tournament at the 2021 Rugby League World Cup in England will see additional turnaround time between matches, increasing from three days to a minimum of four days.

The move follows extensive discussions between the International Rugby League, Rugby League Players Association, national federations and individual players.

The original schedule was agreed in early 2018 but, following complaints about the arduous programme, changes have now been made.

RLWC 2021 chief executive Jon Dutton said: “We have listened to and consulted every interested party over the last few months and we feel this is the best outcome for everyone, particularly the welfare of the athletes.

“It is important that we recognise the evolution of the women’s game and are at the forefront of leading the way on player welfare.
description: The women's tournament at the 2021 Rugby League World Cup in England will see additional turnaround time between matches, increasing from three days to a minimum of four days.
